Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 172 of 262 1883 LC8VMAX6 Rodgers - cross

THE COURT: Thank you.
MR. EVERDELL: Yes, I'll try to be clearer too when I end my question.
Q. You were never told you couldn't mingle with the other passengers?
A. No, never told that.
Q. All right. In fact, you weren't given any rules whatsoever about what you could and couldn't do with the passengers, right?
A. That is correct.
Q. And you were never given any rules whatsoever about how you could interact with the other pilots and the other staff of Mr. Epstein, isn't that right?
A. That is correct.
Q. Now, you did, every once in a while on some of these flights, leave the cockpit to go to the rest room, right?
A. Very few.
Q. Very few.
A. Usually they were Atlantic crossings going to Europe.
Q. I see.
Well, if you did, then on the -- as I you understand it, on the Gulfstream, the bathroom is all the way in the back of the plane, right?
A. That's correct.
Q. So if you wanted to use the rest room, you'd have to leave
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00019034
